document.docTitle: Physocyclus sikuapu Nolasco & Valdez-Mondragón 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of the spider genus Physocyclus Simon, 1893 (Araneae: Pholcidae) from Mexico, with updated taxonomic identification keys

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of the spider genus Physocyclus Simon, 1893 (Araneae: Pholcidae) from Mexico, with updated taxonomic identification keys

paragraph.heading:
Physocyclus sikuapu
sp. nov. Valdez-Mondragón & Nolasco

figureCitation.captionText-0: Figs 38–43. Physocyclus sikuapu sp. nov. Male (holotype). 38–40. Habitus in dorsal, lateral and ventral views, respectively. 41. Carapace in frontal view. 42–43. Chelicerae in frontal and lateral views, respectively. Scale bars: 38–40 = 1 mm; 41–43 = 0.5 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: Figs 44–47. Physocyclus sikuapu sp. nov. Male (holotype). 44–46. Right palp, prolateral, retrolateral and dorsal views, respectively. 47. Bulb of male palp, dorsal view. Scale bars= 0.5 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-2: Figs 48–51. Physocyclus sikuapu sp. nov. Male (holotype). 48–49. Detail of chelicerae, frontal and lateral views, respectively. 50. Details of procursus, embolus and embolic sclerites of right palp, in retrolateral view. 51. Detail of bulb, dorsal view. Scale bars= 0.5 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-3: Figs 52–57. Physocyclus sikuapu sp. nov. Female (paratype). 52–54. Habitus in dorsal, lateral and ventral views, respectively. 55–57. Epigynum, ventral, lateral and dorsal views, respectively (red arrow indicates translucid bag-shaped structure). Scale bars: 52–54 = 1 mm; 55–57 = 0.5 mm.

caption.paragraph:
Fig . 34–37 . Unpublished drawings of
P. mariachi
sp. nov. (= P. “ nayaritus ”) made by W.J. Gertsch, archived at AMNH. 34 . Male palp in retrolateral view. 35–36 . Left male chelicerae in frontal and retrolateral views, respectively. 37 . Female epigynum, dorsal view

subSubSection.paragraph:
Males of
Physocyclus sikuapu
sp. nov. resemble
P. globosus
in having LAC short, by shape of distal spine of PR, pointing to the base of palp femora, and by the half-moon shape of the EE ( Figs 42– 44 , 48–49; VM 2010: figs 42–44). In
P. sikuapu
sp. nov. (1) chelicerae completely flat, without sclerotized cones, with uniform beige coloration ( Figs 42–43 , 48–49); (2) LAC short, conical, pointing down, with SF occupying entire length of chelicerae ( Figs 41–43 , 48–49); (3) ES wider, shorter ( Figs 44, 46–47 , 50–51 ). Females of
P. sikuapu
sp. nov. with (1) bell-shaped epigynum in frontal view, with stretch marks transversally in posterior part ( Figs 55–56 ); (2) VAE small, slightly curved in lateral view ( Fig. 56 ); (3) in dorsal view, PP long, oval, with two bag-shaped structures below them ( Fig. 57 , red arrow).

caption.paragraph:
Figs 38–43.
Physocyclus sikuapu
sp. nov. Male ( holotype ). 38–40 . Habitus in dorsal, lateral and ventral views, respectively. 41 . Carapace in frontal view. 42–43 . Chelicerae in frontal and lateral views, respectively. Scale bars: 38–40 = 1 mm ; 41–43 = 0.5 mm .

subSubSection.paragraph: The species name is a noun in apposition that means spider (sïkuapu = spider ) in the Purépecha language from the pre-Columbian Purépecha state, which existed from the early 14 th century until 1530, and today is known as the state of Michoacan , where the type locality is found.

materialsCitation.collectorName: A. Valdez & I. Navarro & A. Juarez & S. Nolasco
materialsCitation.location: cave at the viewpoint of Costa Aquila

caption.paragraph:
Figs 44–47 .
Physocyclus sikuapu
sp. nov. Male (holotype). 44–46 . Right palp, prolateral, retrolateral and dorsal views, respectively. 47 . Bulb of male palp, dorsal view. Scale bars= 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes
MEXICO • 1 ♂ ; same collection data as for holotype; CNAN-T01474
•
2 ♀♀ ; same collection data as for holotype; CNAN-T01475
.

MEXICO • 8 immatures ; same collection data as for holotype; LATLAX
.

caption.paragraph:
Figs 48–51 .
Physocyclus sikuapu
sp. nov. Male (holotype). 48–49 . Detail of chelicerae, frontal and lateral views, respectively. 50 . Details of procursus, embolus and embolic sclerites of right palp, in retrolateral view. 51 . Detail of bulb, dorsal view. Scale bars= 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male ( holotype , CNAN-T01474)

MEASUREMENTS. Total length 3.8. Carapace 1.7 long, 1.6 wide. Clypeus 0.6 long. Diameter AME 0.08, ALE 0.12, PME 0.11, PLE 0.12. Distance ALE-PME 0.06, PME-PME 0.13. Leg lengths: I (total 38.7): femur 9.8/patella 0.6/tibia 10.6/metatarsus 15.9/tarsus 1.7; tibia II: 7.5; tibia III: 5.3; tibia IV: 7.4. tibia I L/d: 61.2.

caption.paragraph:
Figs 52–57 .
Physocyclus sikuapu
sp. nov. Female (paratype). 52–54 . Habitus in dorsal, lateral and ventral views, respectively. 55–57 . Epigynum, ventral, lateral and dorsal views, respectively (red arrow indicates translucid bag-shaped structure). Scale bars: 52–54 = 1 mm; 55–57 = 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: PROSOMA. Carapace light brown, with a Y-shaped mark around fovea and posterior part of ocular region. Fovea longitudinal. Carapace with three conspicuous irregular spots, barely visible on each side ( Fig. 38 ). Clypeus wide, with same color of carapace ( Fig. 41 ). Chelicerae light beige, without sclerotized cones, with short and conical lateral apophyses, pointing down ( Figs 42 , 48). SF laterally occupying total length of chelicerae ( Figs 42–43 , 48–49). Sternum pale grey, with four pale marks on each side. Labium brown, wider than long. Endites brown, longer than wide ( Fig. 40 ).
LEGS. All segments with light beige coloration. Trochanters light brown, darker than in female. Femora and tibiae with barely visible ring-shaped marks distally.

PALP. DAP thin and conical. In retrolateral view, PR slightly sinuous, with basal half light brown and distal half dark, ending in a long, curved, distal spine ( Figs 44 , 50 ). PR with a notch in basal half. In retrolateral view, ES short, square-shaped ( Figs 44 , 50 ); in dorsal view curved, C-shaped ( Figs 46– 47 , 51 ). E short, square-shaped distally in prolateral view ( Figs 44 , 20 ), long and semi-conical in dorsal view ( Figs 46–47 , 51 ).
Female ( paratype , CNAN-T01475)
Similar to the male, differences:

MEASUREMENTS. Total length: 3. Carapace 1.3 long, 1.3 wide. Clypeus: 0.5. Diameter AME 0.06, ALE 0.11, PME 0.08, PLE 0.12. Distance ALE-PME 0.08, PME-PME 0.12. Leg lengths: I (total 27.7): femur 6.8/patella 0.6/tibia 7.8/metatarsus 11/tarsus 1.6; tibia II: 5.3; tibia III: 3.8; tibia IV:5.5; tibia I L/d: 52.3.

Male paratype collected at the same locality as male holotype is smaller, with a light beige coloration. Sternum with same color as carapace, with irregular darker marks in the periphery. The marks in the opisthosoma are slightly darker. ( N =1): tibia I: missing; tibia II: 7.6; tibia III: 5.4; tibia IV: 7.6.
The other female paratype is a little bigger, with the VAE coloration clearer. ( N =1): tibia I: 8.6; tibia II: 6; tibia III: 4.5; tibia IV: 6.3.
Mexico : Michoacan ( Fig. 78 ).
